argument.description: nvarchar(4000) value representing the formatted value to parse into the specified data type.
Literal representing the data type requested for the result.
Optional string that identifies the culture in which string_value is formatted.

returnType: Returns the result of the expression, translated to the requested data type, or null if the cast fails.
description: Returns the result of an expression, translated to the requested data type, or null if the cast fails in SQL Server. Use TRY_PARSE only for converting from string to date/time and number types.
sample: SELECT TRY_PARSE('Jabberwokkie' AS datetime2 USING 'en-US') AS Result;
